document.id: Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians Res. No. 14-12-22
document.heading: Resolution Number TMBC 14-12-22 of the Duly Elected and Certified Governing Body of the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians

citations.citation: Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians Res. No. 14-12-22

recital.text: the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians, hereinafter referred to as the Tribe, is an unincorporated Band acting under a revised Constitution and By-Laws approved by the Secretary of the Interior on June 16th, 1959 and amendments thereto approved; and

Article IX (a) Section 1 of the Turtle Mountain Constitution and By-Laws empowers the Tribal Council with the authority to represent the Band and to negotiate with Federal, State, and Local Governments and with private persons; and

Article IX (a) Section 1 of the Turtle Mountain Constitution and Bylaws requires a 30-day comment period prior to the adoption of any ordinances or amendments to the Tribal Code, whether proposed by resolution or otherwise. Adoption must occur through a roll call vote of the Tribal Council at a publicly held meeting; and
the Tribe adopted the Law Enforcement Act of 2017 (Chapter 50.06) by Resolution No. TMBC 448-08-17, to provide for public safety through proactive and responsive law enforcement services; and

the Tribe is amending Title 50, Chapter 50.06 Section 50.0615 to add the attached proposed amendments to Section 50.0615 of the Law Enforcement Act of 2017 and amend the title of Chapter 50.06 to DIVISION OF LAW ENFORCEMENT-THE LAW ENFORCEMENT ACT OF 2017; and

the Tribe, by Resolution No. TMBC 1970-11-12, is approved a comment period for proposed amendments to the Law Enforcement Act of 2017 by adding to Title 50, Chapter 50.06 Section 50.0615 the attached proposed amendments and amend the title of Chapter 50.06 to DIVISION OF LAW ENFORCEMENT-THE LAW ENFORCEMENT ACT OF 2017 to provide for public safety through proactive and responsive law enforcement services; and to educate and serve the public and no comments were received; now
that the Tribe is approving the amendments to Title 50 as presented and will codify the Tribal Code accordingly.

procedural-data.text: I, the undersigned, Tribal Secretary of the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians, do hereby certify that the Tribal Council is composed of nine (9) members of whom eight (8) constituting a quorum were present at a meeting duly called, convened and held on the 22nd day of December, 2022 that the foregoing resolution was adopted by an affirmative vote of seven (7) in favor - Representative Ron Trottier, Sr., Jon Jon Keplin, Lynn Gourneau, Craig Lunday, Kenneth Malaterre, Elmer Davis, Jr. and Chad Counts, one (1) absent- Reps. Blaine "Slugger" Davis; none (0) opposed; none (0) absent; with the Tribal Chairman not voting.
